page.title: 04Edwin Hall Farm
page.content: { Edwin Hall Farm}is the least modernised of all the farms our class visited. Geese are kept close to the milking parlour and as we approached they were very protective towards their fluffy goslings. They kept hissing at us. We saw some cows which had very sore feet due to the wet and muddy conditions this year. In the barn were several small calves which we were able to stroke. They were born out of season. Most calves are born between September and January. Mr Turner, the farmer, keeps two large bulls. One weighs over 18 cwt. We watched some of the 108 Friesians being milked. They had only 4 milking machines, so it was a long job. Finally the farmer's wife gave us a drink and a Kit-Kat, which we enjoyed while playing with their sheep-dog.
